intro: Townsendia scapigera var. ambigua, commonly known as the ambiguous Townsend's fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, gray-green leaves and produces daisy-like yellow flowers with white centers. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats, often in mountainous regions. It is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and thistles. This variety is distinguished by its subtle morphological differences from the typical form of Townsendia scapigera.
